comments.text:
Migrators are supposed to notify observers of "Migration:ItemError" when there is an error migrating the specific migration item (ie. bookmarks).  Currently migration.js just logs a message to the error console but the user is not notified in any way and the migrator wizard lists the item as having been successfully imported.  The user should be notified that some data was not migrated.

Minimal solution:
On the summary page of the wizard, indicate which items had errors during migration.

Ideally we also should provide guidance to correct the errors where we can detect the cause.  For example, the file we are looking to migrate from does not exist or a database in the source profile is locked.
comments.author: mozilla+bmo@noorenberghe.ca
comments.creator: mozilla+bmo@noorenberghe.ca
comments.raw_text:
Migrators are supposed to notify observers of "Migration:ItemError" when there is an error migrating the specific migration item (ie. bookmarks).  Currently migration.js just logs a message to the error console but the user is not notified in any way and the migrator wizard lists the item as having been successfully imported.  The user should be notified that some data was not migrated.

Minimal solution:
On the summary page of the wizard, indicate which items had errors during migration.

Ideally we also should provide guidance to correct the errors where we can detect the cause.  For example, the file we are looking to migrate from does not exist or a database in the source profile is locked.

comments.author: limi@mozilla.com
comments.text:
(In reply to Matthew N. [:MattN] from comment #0)
> Minimal solution:
> On the summary page of the wizard, indicate which items had errors during
> migration.

Yes, I think this is fine. Again, it's an exceptional case, so most people won't see it.

I assume we keep the old files somewhere in a backup directory? Not sure anything can be recovered from corrupted files, but might be a nice thing to do for the advanced users that are willing to recover their files in a manual way, extract URLs from a bookmarks file, or similar. I really have no sense if this is possible or even makes any sense, but keeping old files around makes sense to me.
comments.creator: limi@mozilla.com

Not sure anything can be recovered from corrupted files, but might be a nice thing to do for the advanced users that are willing to recover their files in a manual way, extract URLs from a bookmarks file, or similar. I really have no sense if this is possible or even makes any sense, but keeping old files around makes sense to me.

comments.text: *** Bug 1582484 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

comments.raw_text:
This is still a problem that we should fix IMO. In the meantime we now gather some of this data for telemetry so it may be easier to implement. 

Most important is notifying the user when none of the data of a specific type was imported successfully.
comments.creator: mozilla+bmo@noorenberghe.ca
